availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fletcher Harrison (Lyon County, Kentucky, resident and soldier.)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Browning Harrison in Lyon County, Kentucky, on March 29, 1855. Resident of Lyon County in 1862. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 26, 1863, to December 18, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, District 1, p. 14B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0445.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Lyon County Marriages, Film 000321364.
"William Fletcher Harrison (1833-1922)," Find A Grave, Memorial 6656592, accessed January 24, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6656592.
KYR-0001-029-0071.
